question:
With the aid of suitable diagrams, describe the characteristics and mode of formation of any two of the following

(a) Ox-bow lake

(b) Zeugen

(c) Block mountain
answer:
Characteristics and mode of formation of block mountain. Block mountain is formed from faulting and it involves the following:

(i) Two parallel faults develop

(ii) The block enclosed by the two parallel faults remains as it is

(iii) The land on either side of the parallel faults subsides

(iv) The enclosed centre-block, now up standing becomes the horst or block mountain 

(b) Characteristics and mode of formation of Zengen: Zengen is formed as a result of wind abrasion. ​​​​​Zengens are formed in areas in the desert which have a surface layer to hard rock over-lying another layer of soft rock. Before wind abrasion can produce Zengen, fissures or cracks opened by very high temperature on the desert surface must have occurred on the hard surface layer. Wind abrasion then attacks the desert surface through the fissures already existing. The fissures are widened to become furrows while the blocks between the fissures (now furrows) become ridges called "Zengens"

question:

(b) Describe the main characteristics of any two of the features shown

answer:
(b)(i) The main features of continental shelf are:

(i) contains shallow water

(ii) It is a continuation into the of the coastal plain

(iii) It forms a gentle slope into sea

(iv) It is under the influence of wave erosion deposition

(v) It contains lots of planktons

(ii) The main features of ocean deeps are:

(i) They are long nar trenches that plunge as great ocean deeps of over 90

(ii) May or may not be located in the midst of ocean

(i represents the deepest parts of the ocean

 (iv) Contains lots of deposits such as oozes clay, etc

question:

(i) one inland drainage basin
(ii) three rivers that flow into the basin
(iii) the Bight of Benin and Bight of Bonny
(iv) the Idanre Hill, Oban Hills and Biu plateau

(b) Account for the shallowness of the rivers and the lake of the inland drainage basin (c) Describe any four benefits of the lake.
answer:
(b) Reasons for the shallowness of rivers and lakes of the inland drainage basin are:

(i) Water from these rivers always flows into Lake Chad without flowing out

(ii) Silt and other weathered rock materials continue to drop into the lakes

(iii) There is the high evaporation of water in the rivers and the lakes.

(c) Four benefits of the lake include:

(i) For irrigation purposes

(ii) For fishing

(iii) For transportation of goods and people

(iv) For domestic and industrial uses, e.g drinking

question:
(a) On a sketch map of West Africa, show and name (i) the home areas of the Ashanti, the Wolof and the Mandingo
(ii) two areas with a population density of over 100 persons per km2
(iii) two areas with a population density of less than 5 persons per km2

(b) Explain how the variation in population density in West Africa has been aided by the following: (i) Historical factors (11) Agriculture (iii) Mining (iv) Industrialisation
answer:
(b)(i) Historical factors: These have contributed to the variation in the population density in West Africa because ancient cities that developed like Kano, Katsina, Timbuktu are due to trans-saharan trade which took place several years ago. The population of these areas grew because of natural defence during war and being the sites of traditional empires those days

(ii) Agricultural activities tend to have possible effects on population distribution e.g the eastern Nigeria, part of Ashanti developed with high population because of intensive agricultural activities due to fertility of the soil, but where the land is not fertile, people tend to abandon such areas

(iii) Mining; The presence of minerals in certain areas tends to attract high population because of availability of jobs and other facilities in the areas

(iv) Industrialisation. People tend to move to places where there are many industries , as these will help to provide job and improve the standard of living of the people.

answer:
(b) Three ways the highlands of Africa are important:

question:
(a) On a sketch map of Africa, mark and name:
(i) one area receiving rainfall throughout the year
(ii) one area receiving rainfall in summer only
(iii) one warm ocean current (indicating the direction of flow)
(iv) one cold ocean current (indicating the direction of flow)

(b) (i) Identify the type of nature vegetation found in each of the areas shown on your map
(ii) How has rainfall accounted for the difference in vegetation in the two areas?
answer:
(b)(i) The type of vegetation found in:

(1) /Area wi rainfall is throughout the year is equatorial forest

(ii) The type of vegetation found in areas of summer rainfall is savanna grassland

(iii) As a result of continuous rainfall, the vegetation becomes evergreen with tall trees. The trees are of different layers with canopies. But due to rainfall only in summer the trees are deciduous. i.e the trees shed the leaves during the dry season so as to conserve sufficient water. Hence most of the plants found are mainly grasses.
